description: All positive numbers that are not the sum of 5 nonzero squares.
references: J.-M. De Koninck, Ces nombres qui nous fascinent, Entry 33, pp 12, Ellipses, Paris 2008.
E. Grosswald, Representations of Integers as Sums of Squares. Springer-Verlag, NY, 1985, Theorem 2., p. 73.
Ivan Niven and Herbert S. Zuckerman, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers, New York: John Wiley (1980), p. 145
links: Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
example: 4 = 1^2 + 1^2 + 1^2 + 1^2 + 0^2, but the last square is 0, and hence 4 is in the sequence.5 = 1^2 + 1^2 + 1^2 + 1^2 + 1^2, and therefore 5 is not in the sequence.
mathematica: Select[ Range[100], Select[ PowersRepresentations[#, 5, 2], FreeQ[#, 0]& ] == {}& ] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Sep 03 2013 *)
crossrefs: Cf. A047700, A000534, A180968 (not the sum of 6 squares).
author: Arlin Anderson (starship1(AT)gmail.com)
